column1: I’ve an urgent situation to go to China in the next few days, and I wonder if I need a guarantine when I arrive in Beijing. I’ll be flying air China from Montreal directly. Has anyone recently been to China? Thank you.
Probably not but you will need a Chinese Immigration officer to give you a definite answer. https:/…world-asia-china-51718614Edited: 3:13 am, March 05, 2020
you will be quarantined for 14 days .

If your urgent situation is anything other than a close family member in Beijing needing your presence, you need to reconsider. However, if you must go, a nonstop from Canada to China is better than any connection (especially through Japan or Korea). Beijing Municipality has waffled on quarantine requirements and now are trending back stricter. But if you have an address (i.e. family member where you will stay) in Beijing, you may do quarantine there as long as you are not showing symptoms of illness and your plane hasn't been found with an ill passenger on board.

Many Asian countries now worry about double whammy 2nd wave of Coronavirus from foreign countries, one report I saw Beijing already has dozens of cases of imported Coronavirus from foreign travelers, from Iran, Italy etc..,
even a chinese citizen from other city entering bejing need a 14 days quarantine

Hi,My wife has just returned to China (Harbin) and she has to self quarantine at home for 14 days. She also has to report to some authority on a daily basis stating her temperature. However, the situation is changing on a daily basis.
